items.title: Vue.js 3.1 released
items.content:
#â€‹542 â€” June 11, 2021

UnsubscribeÂ Â |Â Â Read on the Web

JavaScript Weekly

Introducing Astro: Ship (Even) Less JavaScript â€” From the creator of Snowpack and Skypack comes a new 'bring your own framework' static site builder where the site is rendered to static HTML and only loads JavaScript as-needed using an â€œislands architectureâ€ to allow partialÂ hydration. It's always fun to see these folks experimenting with how we approachÂ problems. Keen to learn more? This 50Â minute talk + live demo helps aÂ lot.

Fred K. Schott

The Plan for React 18 â€” The React team has outlined some exciting things on the roadmap for React 18 (due in its final form in 'several months' time'):

  • Cassidy Williams has written an accessible 'Now what?' introduction.
  • The first alpha of React 18 is available â€“ it's not for production use.
  • A new Suspense-based server side rendering architecture.
  • A Transitions API for keeping an app responsive even during large updates.
  • The launch of a React 18 Working Group to enable invited members of the community to interact with the React team more directly through these public discussions.

The React Core Team

Learn to Build Scalable React Apps â€” Brian Holt covers the latest tools in the React ecosystem like TypeScript, TailwindCSS, Redux, Jest, and more in this new and updated videoÂ course!

Frontend Masters sponsor

Introducing Chrome's New Memory Inspector â€” Landing in Chrome 91â€™s DevTools is the new memory inspector with which you can inspect your ArrayBuffer, TypedArray, DataView, and even WebAssemblyÂ Memory.

Kim-Anh Tran (Google)

Vue.js 3.1.0 (Pluto) Released â€” Thereâ€™s now the migration build, a build of Vue 3 that offers Vue 2 compatible behavior to help with Vue 2 to 3 migrations. CÃ©dric Exbrayat rounds up some other 3.1 additionsÂ here.

Vue.js Team

Quick Bits

  • There's a new Visual Studio Code release â€” the JavaScript debugger now integrates with the Microsoft Edge DevTools to provide a DOM, style, and network inspector.
  • If you build extensions for Chrome, you'll want to check out the new chrome.scripting API.
  • The Playwright project has introduced Playwright Test, a new test runner for parallel multi-browser tests. Playwright Trace Viewer can then let you explore recorded test traces later on.

Releases

use-sound 4.0 â€” React hook for sound effects.
Cypress 7.5.0 â€” Testing system.
Ghost 4.7.0 â€” Headless Node.js CMS / blogging system.
QUnit 2.16.0 â€” Easy JavaScript testing framework.
Plotly.js 2.0

ğŸ’» Jobs

Frontend Developer at MIT (Remote, Contract to Full-Time) â€” Are you a frontend developer with React and UX skills? Join our team at MIT building a new platform for the energyÂ industry.
MIT Energy Initiative

JavaScript Engineer â€” Join our "kick ass" team. Our software team operates from 17 countries and we're always looking for more exceptionalÂ engineers.
Sticker Mule

Find Software Engineering Jobs with Hired â€” Take 5 minutes to build your free profile & start getting interviews for your next job. Companies on Hired are actively hiring rightÂ now.
Hired

ğŸ“–Â Articles, Opinions & Tutorials

Implementing Private Fields for JavaScript â€” Although you might be using them already via Babel or TypeScript, private fields are a feature being added to JavaScript directly through the TC39 proposalÂ process.

Matthew Gaudet

Creating a Serverless Function to Scrape Web Page Metadata â€” Metascraper is a Node.js package for scraping metadata from live web pages and this tutorial demonstrates its use via a Vercel hostedÂ function.

Matteo Mazzarolo

[Free Download] Guide to Effective Feature Management â€” Learn feature management practices to accelerate release cycles and deploy every 6 hours, instead of every 6Â weeks.

LaunchDarkly sponsor

â–¶Â Â Exploring Deno Land ğŸ¦• with Ryan Dahl â€” Ryan Dahl, the original creator of Node.js creator and now creator of the Deno runtime, went on the popular Changelog podcast to talk about how the success of Node changed his life and what led him to creatingÂ Deno.

The Changelog Podcast podcast

Managing Shared State in Vue 3 â€” Writing large-scale Vue applications can be a challenge. In this article, Shawn Wildermuth dives into the pros and cons of approaches like factories, shared objects, and using Vuex. He also explains what is coming in Vuex 5.0 that might change how we all use shared state in VueÂ 3.

Shawn Wildermuth

Rust from a JavaScript Perspective: A Tongue-in-Cheek Tour â€” â€œI am documenting â€“ albeit in a bit funny way â€“ some thoughts in my journey so far in Rust land, coming from the viewpoint of a hardcore JavaScriptÂ enthusiast.â€

kapolos

Why Tracing Might Replace (Almost) All Logging

Lightstep sponsor

How To Build a Geocoding App with Vue.js and Mapbox
Prince Chukwudire

Ten Tips for Building More Accessible Angular Apps
Emma Twersky (Google)

Don't Use Functions As Callbacks Unless They're Designed for It
Jake Archibald

ğŸ› Â Code & Tools

supported by

Handsfree.JS: Bring Face, Hand or Pose Tracking to Your FrontendÂ Apps â€” Track up to four hands at once (more than Iâ€™ve got, at least), 21 â€˜landmarksâ€™ for a single hand, or even faces and bodies in detail. Iâ€™m also digging the rather retro homepage. GitHubÂ repo.

Oz Ramos

Mocha 9.0 Released: The Popular JavaScript Test Framework â€” Mocha has been a popular go-to test framework for both Node and the browser for years. 9.0 drops Node 10.x support and is going â€˜ES modules firstâ€™ by using ESM import rather than CommonJS require to load test files byÂ default.

Mocha

Flicking 4.0: A Carousel Component with 30M Daily Users â€” Naver, a South Korean portal and search engine, claims 30 million people use their carousel component every day. Works with Angular, React, Vue andÂ Preact.

NAVER

[New] Free JavaScript Code Quality & Security Scanner - Realâ€‘TimeÂ Scan â€” Like Grammarly for your code. Scan your JavaScript code for quality & security issues, and get fix advice in yourÂ IDE.

Snyk sponsor

FlexSearch.js 0.7.0: A Full Text Search Library with No Dependencies â€” Claims to outperform its competition while supporting features like multi-word matching and phonetic transformations. Happy in both the browser andÂ Node.js.

Nextapps GmbH

PM2 5.0 Released: The Production Process Manager â€” PM2 is a popular process manager and load balancer for long running Node.js apps. 5.0 is a significant release adding a new local system monitoring feature for tracking metrics like CPU and memoryÂ use.

Alexandre Strzelewicz

Naive UI: A Vue 3 Component Library â€” I kinda respect it describes itself as â€œnot too slowâ€ and â€œkindaÂ interestingâ€(!)

TuSimple

Nanostores: A 152 Byte State Manager for React/Preact/Vue/Svelte with Many Atomic Tree-Shakable Stores
Andrey Sitnik

Angular Flex-Layout: A Sophisticated Layout API for Angular using Flexbox Media Queries
Angular

ğŸµÂ And one for fun..

RxJChess: A Chess Game Built on React, Redux and RxJS â€” You can play against the CPU or even find a friend. Plays pretty well. Once youâ€™ve had enough of losing (or is that just me?) you can also check out theÂ source.

Prashanth Selvam

items.title: Svelte for the experienced React developer
items.content:
#â€‹541 â€” June 4, 2021

UnsubscribeÂ Â |Â Â Read on the Web

JavaScript Weekly

Making JavaScript Run Fast on WebAssembly â€” Twenty years ago, JavaScript had a reputation of being rather slow but a huge amount of time, money and research went into making it incredibly fast in the browser. Now, the Bytecode Alliance is supporting work to do the same with optimizing performance in new environments opened up by WebAssembly. Lin illustrates whatâ€™s going on in her usual easily understoodÂ style.

Lin Clark (Bytecode Alliance)

Svelte for the Experienced React Dev â€” Svelte distinguishes itself from other frameworks by gaining efficiency with build time (as opposed to run time) compilation to vanilla JS. This walks through the basics with a React-leaning eye.

Adam Rackis

Couchbase Is the SQL-Friendly, NoSQL JSON Document Database â€” Couchbase has integrations available for Spring, Node, ASP.NET, and more. Read and write your data with a fusion of NoSQL flexibility and SQL familiarity. Check out developer.couchbase.com today for sample apps andÂ tutorials.

Couchbase sponsor

â–¶Â Â The History of Angular with Misko Hevery â€” The original developer of Angular talks about the history of the framework. 37Â minutes.

Angular Rocks Podcast podcast

Quick Bits

  • Chrome 92 is out in beta and the File Handling API now lets your PWAs define file handlers (origin trial only for now), V8 9.2 is included too with numerous JavaScript enhancements.
  • Chrome 92's DevTools are looking sharp too. As well as a CSS Grid editor, consts can now be redeclared if you're working in the console.
  • A look at the stage 3 Array.prototype.at proposal led to some discussion on Hacker News.
  • After only a brief moment in the sun, Node.js 15 has gone 'end of life.' Upgrade to Node 16 ASAP. Node has also just turned 12 years oldÂ ğŸ‚
  • The Google Maps JavaScript API has some new powerful WebGL-powered functionality if you want to tilt, rotate, or work with 3D structures on your maps.

Releases

Node v16.3.0 â€” Runner of the codes.
Electron 13 â€” Build desktop apps with Node 14.16 and Chromium 91.
Acorn 8.3 â€” Pure JS JavaScript parser.
Forever 4.0 â€” CLI app to run a script forever.

ğŸ’» Jobs

JavaScript Graphics Engineer â€” Join our "kick ass" team. Our software team operates from 17 countries and we're always looking for more exceptionalÂ engineers.
Sticker Mule

JavaScript Developer at X-Team (Remote) â€” Join the most energizing community for developers and work on long-term projects for Riot Games, FOX, Sony, Coinbase, andÂ more.
X-Team

Find Software Engineering Jobs with Hired â€” Take 5 minutes to build your free profile & start getting interviews for your next job. Companies on Hired are actively hiring rightÂ now.
Hired

ğŸ“–Â Articles, Opinions & Tutorials

Getting Started with webpack â€” If youâ€™re already working with webpack, scroll on by, but otherwise this is a reasonable beginner-oriented introduction to the mainÂ concepts.

Nwani Victory (Smashing Magazine)

State Management in Vue 3 Applications with Vuex â€” A practical introduction (based around a e-commerce style example) to modern state management in a Vue 3Â app.

Fikayo Adepoju

An Introduction to WebAssembly for JavaScript Developers â€” Less a conceptual intro and more a code-driven recipe book, this guide jumps right into loading bytecode, passing values back and forth, and working withÂ buffers.

Pascal Pares

The Modern Guide to OAuth â€” This guide is based on our experience building FusionAuth, an OAuth server that has been downloaded over 5 millionÂ times.

FusionAuth sponsor

An Introduction to Trigonometry with CSS and JavaScript â€” A three-part overview of trigonometry, understanding how it can be useful, and diving into some creative applications in CSS andÂ JavaScript.

Michelle Barker

â–¶Â Â A Chat with TC39 Delegate Daniel Ehrenberg â€” Itâ€™s not an official TC39 podcast, but it might as well be. Hemanth talks to Daniel Ehrenberg whoâ€™s worked on numerous ECMAScript proposals (such as the DecimalÂ proposal).

TC39er Podcast podcast

How to Use Pivot Tables with SpreadJS â€” SpreadJS is a commercial JavaScript spreadsheet control, but itâ€™s interesting to see what sort of functionality you canÂ get.

Mackenzie Albitz

How To Create User Interactions with Events in Vue
Dave Berning

â–¶Â Â Using Async, Await, and Promises in Express.js
Beyond Code Workshop

Using the X-Amzn-Trace-Id Header For Request Tracing Through Amazon's LoadÂ Balancers
Ben Nadel

How to Memoize with React.useMemo()
Dmitri Pavlutin

ğŸ› Â Code & Tools

D3Funnel 2.0: A Library for Rendering Funnel Charts using D3.js â€” Useful if you want to represent values as a process passes through various stages, say.

Jake Zatecky

Jsonmatic: Transform CSV Data into JSON â€” A simple online tool for uploading a CSV file and getting some JSONÂ back.

Erik MartÃ­n JordÃ¡n

Breakpoints and console.log Is the Past, Time Travel Is theÂ Future â€” 15x faster JavaScript debugging than with breakpoints andÂ console.log.

Wallaby.js sponsor

ts-audio: Work with AudioContext More Easily â€” Want a demo complete with code? Here you go. You can create audio playlistsÂ too.

Evandro Leopoldino GonÃ§alves

PLV8 3.0: V8 JavaScript, But for Postgres â€” JavaScript in the browser, on the server.. but what about inside your Postgres database? PLV8 brings the power of JavaScript into Postgres functions by way of this extension which has just hit a new majorÂ version.

plv8 team

Handsontable 9.0: A Mature Data Grid That Feels Like a Spreadsheet â€” Plain JavaScript, Vue, Angular, React - it works with them all (demo). Note that itâ€™s dual licensed, so is only free for evaluation or non-commercial use. GitHubÂ repo.

Handsoncode

Svelte-Motion: Animation Library for Svelte based on FramerÂ Motion â€” An animation library for Svelte apps based on Framer Motion. Still in beta but the homepage itself shows off some of theÂ functionality.

Michael Lucht

[Free Download] Guide to Effective Feature Management

LaunchDarkly sponsor

ethers.js: Complete Ethereum Library and Wallet Implementation in JS
ethers-io

useStateMachine: The Â½KB State Machine React Hook
Cassio Zen

A Vue 3 Starter App with Vite, TypeScript, ESLint and Prettier
Jenyus

items.title: V8 finds another 5-15% performance boost
items.content:
#â€‹540 â€” May 28, 2021

UnsubscribeÂ Â |Â Â Read on the Web

JavaScript Weekly

Sparkplug: V8's Non-Optimizing JavaScript Compiler â€” When you wonder just where the V8 team will pull out a few more % of performance improvements, they come up with something :-). Their new â€˜super-fast non-optimizing compilerâ€™ in V8 v9.1 sits in between the existing interpreter and TurboFan compiler engines and brings another 5-15% boost to benchmarks. Firefox has had a similar concept in the shape of the baselineÂ interpreter.

Leszek Swirski (V8 Team)

Locate Front-End Issues Like JavaScript or Network Errors Instantly â€” Get proactively alerted on any client-side issues such as JavaScript and network errors, optimize the load time of your front-end resources, and detect any UI issues that affect critical user journeys. Try it free with DatadogÂ Synthetics.

Datadog sponsor

TypeScript 4.3 Released â€” Just a couple of weeks after the beta comes the real deal with a rather long featureÂ list:

  • An override keyword to explicitly define overridingÂ methods.
  • A --noImplicitOverride flag to make it an error to override methods in superclasses without using the aforementioned override.
  • Template string type improvements.
  • Methods and accessors can now be given private names, e.g. getÂ #someValue().
  • static index signatures.
  • And, yes, a lot more.

Daniel Rosenwasser (Microsoft)

Jest 27 Released, Complete with Some New Defaults â€” Jest has â€˜flipped some switchesâ€™ and introduced some new defaults youâ€™ll want to be aware of if you use the popular testing framework. You can now also interactively step through failed tests one at a time, get inline snapshots without using Prettier, and you get much faster initialization times than Jest 26Â too.

Tim Seckinger

Quick Bits

  • The Angular project has unveiled an improved process for managing featureÂ requests.
  • ğŸ‰ Node.js has turned 12 years old. You can still grab v0.0.1.
  • Flow is a JavaScript static type checker out of Facebook that saw a lot of growth before TypeScript ate everyone's lunch. The project has issued a post clarifying Flow's future direction which is basically "Flow is staying open source but is going to focus even more on Facebook's own useÂ cases."

Releases

fabric.js 4.5 â€” JS Canvas framework (and SVG to Canvas parser).
Chart.js 3.3 â€” Simple, flexible JS charting.
xstyled 3.0 â€” CSS-in-JS framework built for React.
Cypress 7.4.0 â€” Testing system.
ESLint 7.27.0 â€” Find and fix problems in your JavaScript.

ğŸ’» Jobs

Senior Frontend Engineer - Remote â€” Looking for a JS enthusiast who loves TypeScript, Next.js, and SSR. Let's build the future of financeÂ together.
Kikoff

JavaScript Developer at X-Team (Remote) â€” Join the most energizing community for developers and work on long-term projects for Riot Games, FOX, Sony, Coinbase, andÂ more.
X-Team

Find Software Engineering Jobs with Hired â€” Take 5 minutes to build your free profile & start getting interviews for your next job. Companies on Hired are actively hiring rightÂ now.
Hired

ğŸ“–Â Articles, Opinions & Tutorials

â–¶Â Â How To Create Your First Flow in Node-RED â€” Node-RED is a browser-based â€˜flowâ€™ programming environment that uses Node.js under the hood. An interesting alternative way to build JavaScript powered systems.

Bleeding Code

A Thorough Analysis of CSS-in-JS â€” I feel too old-fashioned to fully buy into writing CSS alongside my JavaScript (sorry!) but Andrei does a good job at selling the benefits and compares someÂ approaches.

Andrei Pfeiffer

Build a Node.js App with CockroachDB and the Node.js pg Driver â€” In this tutorial youâ€™ll learn how to build a simple Node.js application with CockroachDB and the Node.js pgÂ driver.

Cockroach Labs sponsor

Building a Rich WYSIWYG Text Editor From Scratch â€” Learn how to build a rich text editor into an app with Slate doing the heavyÂ lifting.

Shalabh Vyas

The Modern Guide to React State Patterns â€” At one stage, you could basically just say â€˜use Reduxâ€™ but there are so many options now, and this guide flies through a fewÂ approaches.

Fredrik Strand Oseberg

New Standards to Access User Device Hardware from JavaScript â€” WebHID, WebNFC, and Web Serial have opened up new avenues to interact with userâ€™s device hardware for web apps. Device and browser support is kinda patchy, however.

Viduni Wickramarachchi

Using Pinia, an Alternative Vue.js Store â€” If you want to just go straight to the library, hereâ€™s its homepage (cuteÂ logo!)

Daniel Kelly

[Free Download] Guide to Effective Feature Management â€” Learn feature management practices to accelerate release cycles and deploy every 6 hours, instead of every 6Â weeks.

LaunchDarkly sponsor

Get Started with React by Building a 'Whac-a-Mole' Game â€” This is truly aimed at beginners keen to strike some â€˜aha!â€™ moments while learning React. Using it to create a simple game certainly could take you out of your comfortÂ zone.

Jhey Tompkins

Where's The Best Place to Host a Next.js Site? â€” A detailed look at deploying a Next.js app to Vercel, Netlify, Layer0 and Heroku and rating them based upon a variety ofÂ factors.

Ondrej Polesny

A Beginner's Guide to Vue 3
Catalin Pit

ğŸ› Â Code & Tools

supported by

Boring Avatars: React Library to Generate Custom Avatars â€” Ranging from generic gradients to face-like creations, this library (GitHub repo) generates custom, SVG-based, round avatars from any username and colorÂ palette.

Boring Designers

CandyGraph: A Fast, Flexible 2D Plotting Library â€” A flexible and fast-by-default 2D plotting library tuned for rendering huge datasets on the GPU at interactive speeds. And if that sounds like a boast, hit up the examples (the animated ones lower down are the mostÂ interesting).

Rye Terrell

Drag-n-Drop Email Editor for React, Angular and Vue

Unlayer sponsor

threads.js: Web Workers Meet Worker Threads â€” Threads is both a terrifying nuclear apocalypse movie and also this library for making using both Web Workers and worker threads (as implemented in Node) as simple as possible. Outsourcing intensive code to other threads can really help in someÂ cases.

Andy Wermke

NocoDB: An Open Source Airtable-a-Like â€” Airtable is a popular commercial spreadsheet-database service that we even use here at Cooperpress to help put the newsletters together. This is a flexible and surprisingly good looking open sourceÂ pastiche with a Vue poweredÂ frontend.

nocodb team

ts-node 10.0: TypeScript Execution and REPL for Node
TypeStrong

eslint-plugin-tailwindcss: ESLint Plugin for Tailwind CSS Usage
Francois Massart

Velociraptor 1.0: npm-Style Script Runner for Deno
JurassiScripts
items.contentSnippet:
#â€‹540 â€” May 28, 2021


UnsubscribeÂ Â |Â Â Read on the Web



JavaScript Weekly




  





  
  
Sparkplug: V8's Non-Optimizing JavaScript Compiler â€” When you wonder just where the V8 team will pull out a few more % of performance improvements, they come up with something :-). Their new â€˜super-fast non-optimizing compilerâ€™ in V8 v9.1 sits in between the existing interpreter and TurboFan compiler engines and brings another 5-15% boost to benchmarks. Firefox has had a similar concept in the shape of the baselineÂ interpreter.
Leszek Swirski (V8 Team) 


  
  
Locate Front-End Issues Like JavaScript or Network Errors Instantly â€” Get proactively alerted on any client-side issues such as JavaScript and network errors, optimize the load time of your front-end resources, and detect any UI issues that affect critical user journeys. Try it free with DatadogÂ Synthetics.
Datadog sponsor

items.title: Running Node natively in the browser
items.content:
#â€‹539 â€” May 21, 2021

UnsubscribeÂ Â |Â Â Read on the Web

JavaScript Weekly

DOM Events: A Way to Visualize and Experiment with the DOM EventÂ System â€” A visualizer to help you learn about the DOM Event system â€“ not always the easiest thing to get a mental model of â€“ throughÂ exploration.

Alex Reardon

Introducing WebContainers: Run Node.js Natively in the Browser â€” An interesting new WebAssembly-based operating system that boots instantly and enables Node.js environments to run directly in the browser. People have been getting very excited about this on Twitter. Only supports Chromium-based browsers for nowÂ though.

Eric Simons (StackBlitz)

New & Updated Course: Complete Intro to React v6 with Brian Holt â€” Learn to build real-world applications using modern React. Much more than an intro, youâ€™ll start from the ground up, getting to using the latest features in React, including hooks, effects, context, and portals, plus piecing together tools from the entire ReactÂ ecosystem.

Frontend Masters sponsor

Parcel 2 Beta 3: A Wild Rust Appears! â€” How does a â€˜beta 3â€™ release get a feature? By having its JavaScript compiler entirely rewritten in Rust is how. This change yields a â€œ10x fasterâ€ compiler and continues an ongoing trend of writing JavaScript tools in other languages (such as esbuild, written in Go). There is more to the release, though - detailsÂ within.

ParcelJS

Quick Bits

  • Are you ready to shed a tear when Microsoft fully retires Internet Explorer on June 15, 2022?
  • Enjoy this 'snake' game implemented in 27 lines of JS on CodePen.
  • I admit I've not had much time to look at these maps of JavaScript concepts but they make for pretty overwhelming visuals - interesting!
  • The Next.js Conf site is a sort of multiplayer experience. It takes place online on June 15, BTW.

Releases

Node 16.2.0
create-node-cli 1.6.0 â€” Tool to create new Node CLI projects.
lowdb 2.0.0 â€” Tiny local JSON database for small projects.

ğŸ’» Jobs

Lead Frontend Development at Fleet (100% Remote) â€” Work with the creators of Sails.js + osquery at our new venture building a better way to manage employee laptops andÂ servers.
Fleet

Find Software Engineering Jobs with Hired â€” Take 5 minutes to build your free profile & start getting interviews for your next job. Companies on Hired are actively hiring rightÂ now.
Hired

ğŸ“–Â Articles, Opinions & Tutorials

2D Optics Demos in JavaScript â€” A fun bit of visuals meeting code. These little live experiments areÂ neat.

Philip Zucker

â–¶Â Â A Complete Beginner's Guide to Next.js â€” Ali keeps it engaging and easily digestible in this 22-minute video. Well recorded. Fantastic.

Ali Spittel

Breakpoints and console.log Is the Past, Time Travel Is theÂ Future â€” 15x faster JavaScript debugging than with breakpoints andÂ console.log.

Wallaby.js sponsor

How to Create Reusable Web Components with Lit and Vue â€” A thorough walk through creating a button component using the Lit framework for use in a Vue.jsÂ app.

Dan Valinotti

Tree-Shaking: A Reference Guide â€” A high-level, though comprehensive, introduction to what â€˜tree shakingâ€™ is all about. The basic idea is that unused code from modules you use gets â€˜shakenâ€™ off like dead leaves on aÂ tree.

Ãtila Fassina

Embedding Google Forms in a Static Site Without iFrames â€” An approach promising more customizability than embedding a Google FormÂ IFRAME.

Brian May

â–¶Â Â 'TypeScript is Testing' â€” In a 3-minute micro podcast episode, Kent makes the argument that TypeScript is like testing because of the extra confidence it gives you about yourÂ code.

Kent C Dodds podcast

Provision Infrastructure with JavaScript and Pulumi â€” Build, deploy, and manage modern cloud applications and infrastructure usingÂ JavaScript.

Pulumi sponsor

â–¶Â Â Frontend Development in 2021: A Complete Guide â€” A tight 20-minute look at the frontend landscape, covering the libraries and tech youâ€™ll want toÂ know. One worth sharing with anyone you know who's interested in getting into theÂ space.

Harry Wolff

A Guide to Unit Testing Vue Components
Patrick Kennedy

How to Use Tailwind's Just-in-Time Mode in Angular
Amadou Sall

ğŸ› Â Code & Tools

Typehole: VS Code Tool to Automatically Generate TypeScript Types and Interfaces â€” An extension that helps you automate creating the initial static types for runtimeÂ values.

Riku Rouvila

Sublime Text 4 Released â€” While VS Code has become extremely popular in the past few years, Sublime Text used to be huge and itâ€™s great to see a new major version. TypeScript, JSX and TSX support are baked in, as is Apple Silicon support, GPU rendering, andÂ more.

Sublime Blog

[New] Free JavaScript Code Quality & Security Scanner - Realâ€‘TimeÂ Scan

Snyk sponsor

A Boilerplate for SSRâ€™d Vite, React 17, and TypeScript 4.3 â€” Considers itself a â€œbarebones, slightly-opinionatedâ€ boilerplate for working with a modern webÂ stack.

JonLuca DeCaro

lightGallery: A Well Presented, Modular JS Image and Video Lightbox Gallery â€” Works with React.js, Vue.js, Angular, and TypeScript. Demos here or the GitHub repo. Been around a while but as of this week no longer relies on jQuery! GNUÂ licensed.

Sachin N

Vuestic UI 1.0: A Vue.js 3.0 UI Framework â€” Features more than 50 highly customizableÂ components.

Vuestic UI

ReacType 7.0: A Visual Prototyping Tool for React Developers â€” The popular drag-and-drop React prototyping tool with code preview is now in its seventh major release. Kevin Park has written an extensive article on it which provides an in-depth review of its capabilities.

OSLabs

ğŸ’š Use Node? Check out the latest issue of Node Weekly, our sibling email about all things relating to Node.js â€” from tutorials and screencasts to news and releases. Yep, we do include some Node related items here in JavaScript Weekly, but we save most of it for there.

â†’ Check out NodeÂ WeeklyÂ today

ğŸµÂ And one for fun..

Trombone.js: Yep, It's a Trombone.. â€” I donâ€™t know the first thing about playing the trombone, but here you go. The source is here along with an explanation of how it works. Allegedly it â€œclosely approximates the acoustic properties of (a) real tromboneâ€. I always found the 'pink trombone' vocal synthesizer (yes, itâ€™s safe for work!) aÂ laugh.

Jeffrey Auriemma

title: JavaScript Weekly
description: A newsletter of JavaScript articles, news and cool projects
